name: shapes-library
title: PowerPoint Shapes Library
description: Browse and insert editable PowerPoint shapes into your presentations
author: arthur.andrade

commands.name: capture-shape
commands.title: Capture Shape from PowerPoint
commands.description: Extract selected shape and add to library

commands.name: manage-categories
commands.title: Manage Categories
commands.description: Add, rename, or delete shape categories

preferences.name: enableCache
preferences.title: Enable Cache
preferences.description: Cache shape definitions for faster loading
preferences.label: Enable caching of shape definitions

preferences.name: autoCleanup
preferences.title: Auto Cleanup Temp Files
preferences.description: Automatically delete temporary PowerPoint files after 60 seconds
preferences.label: Enable automatic cleanup

preferences.name: libraryPath
preferences.title: Library Folder
preferences.description: Absolute path to store shapes JSON, previews and native PPTX. Leave empty to use app data.

preferences.name: autoSaveAfterCapture
preferences.title: Auto-save after capture
preferences.description: Automatically save the captured shape to the library without showing the form
preferences.label: Save immediately after capture

preferences.name: forceExactShapes
preferences.title: Force Exact Shapes Only
preferences.description: Block open/copy if there is no native PPTX (100% fidelity)
preferences.label: Require native PPTX to use shapes

preferences.name: useLibraryDeck
preferences.title: Use PPTX Library Deck
preferences.description: Store shapes inside a single PPTX deck and copy from it
preferences.label: Enable library deck

preferences.name: skipNativeSave
preferences.title: Skip native PPTX save at capture
preferences.description: Avoid saving a PPTX during capture (faster, more reliable). Native insert still works and you can save later.
preferences.label: Skip native save on capture

preferences.name: templatePath
preferences.title: PowerPoint Template Path (Optional)
preferences.description: Path to a PPTX template with your company theme. If provided, all captures will use this template's theme, colors, and fonts. Leave empty to use Office default theme.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
